section.title: Vehicle features and options
section.paragraph: This chapter describes model-specific equipment, systems and functions that are available now and will be available in the future, even if they are not available in the owned vehicle.
Additional information:
Vehicle equipment.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The tire condition and tire pressure influence the following:

item.paragraph: The service life of the tires.
Driving safety.
Driving comfort.
Fuel consumption.
Electrical consumption.

overview.overview-text: Checking the tire pressure regularly

warning.paragraph: Warning

A tire with too little or no tire inflation pressure may heat up significantly and sustain damage. This will have a negative impact on aspects of handling, such as steering and braking response. There is a risk of accident. Regularly check the tire inflation pressure, and correct it as needed, for instance twice a month and before a long trip.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: The tire inflation pressure details can be found on the door pillar of the driver's door.

The tire pressures apply to all tire sizes and recommended tire brands that were approved by the manufacturer of the vehicle for the vehicle type. The list can include tire sizes that are only suitable in combination with specific equipment.
Information about approved wheels and tires for the vehicle can be requested from an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop.

The tire pressures stated for the respective load status will apply, in accordance with the vehicle's actual load status. In the case of partially loaded vehicles, the specified tire pressure for a partially loaded vehicle is the optimal tire pressure.

overview.overview-text: Obtain information on tire inflation pressure specifications from the tire center

warning.paragraph: Warning

The tire pressures on the tire label are applicable only for tires explicitly mentioned on the plaque. Since inflation pressures for tires that may be covered by the plaque – by size, speed category and load rating/load index – but not explicitly mentioned on the plaque may be different. Please obtain adequate tire pressures in accordance with the tire manufacturer's specifications at your tire center.

section.title: In the tire inflation pressure table
section.paragraph: The tire inflation pressure table contains all tire inflation pressure specifications for the specified tire sizes at the ambient temperature. The tire inflation pressure values are in the printed Owner's Manual and apply to tire sizes approved by the manufacturer of the vehicle for the vehicle type.
To identify the correct tire inflation pressure, please note the following:

item.paragraph: Tire sizes of your vehicle.
Maximum speed for driving.

section.title: On the control display
section.paragraph: The current tire inflation pressure values and the intended tire inflation pressure values for the mounted tires can be displayed on the Control Display.
The current tire inflation pressure values for the mounted tires can be displayed on the Control Display.
To ensure that they are displayed correctly, the tire sizes must be stored in the system and must have been set for the mounted tires.
The current tire inflation pressure value is located on each tire.
The reference tire inflation pressure value is located in the lower area of the control display.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: Additional information is located in the BMW ALPINA Supplementary Owner's Manual.
Tires heat up while driving. The tire pressure increases with the tire temperature.
Tires have a natural, consistent tire pressure loss.
The displays of inflation devices may under-read by up to 0.1 bar0.1 bar/2 psi.

title.pcdata-case: Checking using tire inflation pressure specifications on the door pillar
Checking using tire inflation pressure specifications in the tire inflation pressure table

action-step.paragraph: Determine the intended tire inflation pressure levels for the mounted tires.
Check the tire inflation pressure in all four tires, using a pressure gage, for example.
Correct the tire inflation pressure if the actual tire inflation pressure deviates from the intended tire inflation pressure.
Check whether all valve caps are screwed onto the tire valves.

section.paragraph: The tire inflation pressure specifications on the tire pressure label on the door pillar only relate to cold tires or tires at the same temperature as the ambient temperature.
The tire inflation pressure specifications in the tire inflation pressure table only relate to cold tires or tires at the same temperature as the ambient temperature.
Only check the tire inflation pressure levels when the tires are cold, i.e.:

item.paragraph: A distance traveled of max. 2 km2 km, approx. 1.25 miles1.25 miles/2 km has not been exceeded.
If the vehicle has not moved again for at least two hours after a trip.

section.paragraph: If equipped with an emergency wheel: check the tire pressure of the emergency wheel in the cargo area regularly and correct if necessary.

section.title: Checking using the tire inflation pressure specifications on the Control Display

action-step.paragraph: Check whether the current tire inflation pressure levels deviate from the intended tire pressure value.
Correct the tire pressure of a tire if the current tire pressure deviates from the intended tire pressure.

section.paragraph: The display of the current tire pressure may be limited when the vehicle is stationary. After a short drive, the tire pressure is updated.

section.title: After correcting the tire pressure
section.paragraph: If equipped with a Tire Pressure Monitor, the corrected tire pressures are applied automatically. Make sure that the correct tire settings have been made. With tires that cannot be found in the tire pressure values on the control display, reset the Tire Pressure Monitor (TPM).
If equipped with a flat tire monitor, reinitialize the flat tire monitor.

entry.paragraph: up to 160 km/h160 km/h/100 mph100 mph/160 km/h
up to 170 km/h170 km/h/106 mph106 mph/170 km/h
up to 180 km/h180 km/h/112 mph112 mph/180 km/h
up to 190 km/h190 km/h/118 mph118 mph/190 km/h
up to 210 km/h210 km/h/131 mph131 mph/210 km/h

above 300 km/h300 km/h/186 mph186 mph/300 km/h

section.title: Tire inflation pressures up to 100 mph/160 km/h
section.paragraph: For speeds of up to 100 mph/160 km/h and for optimum driving comfort, note the tire pressure values in the printed Owner's Manual and adjust as necessary.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: These pressure values can also be found on the tire pressure label on the driver's door pillar.

section.paragraph: Do not exceed a speed of 100 mph/160 km/h.

section.title: Tire inflation pressures at max. speeds above 100 mph/160 km/h

overview.overview-text: Speeds above 100 mph/160 km/h

warning.paragraph: Warning

In order to drive at maximum speeds in excess of 100 mph/160 km/h, please observe and, if necessary, adjust tire pressures for speeds exceeding 100 mph/160 km/h from the relevant table on the following pages. Otherwise, tire damage and accidents could occur.

section.paragraph: For speeds over 100 mph/160 km/h and for optimum driving comfort, note the tire pressure values in the printed Owner's Manual and adjust as necessary.

section.title: Tire size
section.paragraph: 245: nominal width in mm
45: cross-sectional relationship in %
R: radial tire code
18: rim diameter in inches
96: load bearing capacity
Y: speed code letter
ZR tires: reinforced radial tire for speeds exceeding 240 km/h240 km/h/150 mph150 mph/240 km/h

section.title: Maximum tire load
section.paragraph: Maximum tire load is the maximum permissible weight for which the tire is approved.

Locate the maximum tire load on the tire sidewall and the Gross Axle Weight Rating – GAWR – on the certification label on the driver door B-pillar. Divide the tire load by 1.1. It must be greater than one-half of the vehicle’s Gross Axle Weight Rating – GAWR. Note, front vs. rear GAWR and tire loads, respectively.

entry.paragraph: up to 160 km/h160 km/h/100 mph100 mph/160 km/h
up to 170 km/h170 km/h/106 mph106 mph/170 km/h
up to 180 km/h180 km/h/112 mph112 mph/180 km/h
up to 190 km/h190 km/h/118 mph118 mph/190 km/h
up to 210 km/h210 km/h/131 mph131 mph/210 km/h
up to 240 km/h240 km/h/150 mph150 mph/240 km/h
